copy: Push your limits. All the time. My current areas of focus include digging deeper into the capabilities of CSS, the history and future of layouts on the Web, dynamic programming, and modular systems. These projects showcase some of the end results of my explorations.

projects.name: ninja strings
projects.description: WordPress-based website for a booking agency for string players in central and northern Virginia.

projects.name: funko pop store
projects.description: The capstone project of the Design for the Web course.  Built from scratch with the Vue framework, running on the Node.js runtime environment.

projects.name: figma-to-code
projects.description: Coding out a pixel-perfect rendering of three Figma templates composed from a library of components and UI kits.

projects.name: highways of virginia
projects.description: A responsive multi-page site that allows users to dynamically create their own data as well as make changes to it. As with the previous projects, we continued with the ideas of theming, typography and other layout elements.

projects.name: outer banks vacation rentals
projects.description: Theming, research, and replication. After choosing a topic to research, we made use of a custom CSS framework to imitate as closely as possible the major attributes of the chosen theme -- typefaces, color scheme, and overall layout.
